SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Release Notes and Upgrade Guide

Check out what’s new in each release of the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package, and learn how to upgrade your implementation.

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13) Release Notes
Provide your merchandisers and admins with more tools for managing your product catalog and storefront metadata with greater efficiency. Apply important security and behavior enhancements that keep your storefront secure, compliant, and running smoothly.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12) Release Notes
Provide your merchandisers and admins with more tools for managing your product catalog and storefront metadata with greater efficiency. Apply important security and behavior enhancements that keep your storefront secure, compliant, and running smoothly.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11) Release Notes
Streamline your brand's ecommerce experience with new resources for unifying your Experience Cloud site, boosting discovery of your storefront, and analyzing user traffic. Continue to deliver incremental performance improvements and reinforce the integrity of your storefront and user data. Further customize and fine-tune your storefront's user experience.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (Version 4.10) Release Notes
Boost your storefront’s search engine optimization (SEO) ranking, deliver page content to your storefront users faster, and enjoy a more efficient admin experience. Trust the integrity of your B2B Commerce for Visualforce data, and get started with new storefronts more quickly.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9) Release Notes
Deliver a faster experience for users on the Product List page, and take advantage of new performance and security enhancements.
Upgrade B2B Commerce for Visualforce to a New Release or Patch
To upgrade an existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce implementation, install the new version of the managed package and load the latest configuration and custom settings data. Then, review the release notes for all versions along your upgrade path, and complete the appropriate upgrade steps as necessary. If you're installing a patch, also check the notes for each patch released for the major version you installed for any extra upgrade steps.
Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure by Default
Several security alerts are automatically enabled with the Salesforce Summer ’20 release and become mandatory with the Salesforce Winter ’21 release. These alerts affect the ability of any storefront user to log in, and affect the ability of guest users to self-register, browse, create carts, and check out. These alerts also affect managed package code that executes in the context of a guest user. To maintain guest user access on your storefront, install B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) or the latest patch for your version. Then, complete the extra steps required for resolving the security alerts.
Maintain Established CloudCraze Solutions
Does your solution use a version of the managed package earlier than B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)? Keep your CloudCraze 4.8, 4.7, 4.6, or 4.5 storefront secure by default by applying available patches and completing required updates.
